updateMenu.deleted: The following effects will be DELETED from a previous version of 'PF2e Animations'.
updateMenu.added: The following effects are going to be added to your Autorecognition settings.
updateMenu.custom: The following effects won't be added due to them already existing from an unknown source.
updateMenu.customHint: If you want the 'PF2e Animations' version, delete them from your Autorecognition Menu.
updateMenu.updated: The following effects will be updated from a previous version of 'PF2e Animations' (or from Automated Animations default menu).
updateMenu.blacklisted: The following effects have been blacklisted and will be removed from your Autorecognition Menu.
updateMenu.warning: Make sure to backup your autorecognition menu! THIS PROCESS IS IRREVERSIBLE.
updateMenu.debugCustom: The following effects do not exist in PF2e Animations, they are completely new and will remain in your Autorecognition Menu.

notifications.noJB2A: You need a JB2A module enabled to use with PF2e Animations module!
notifications.update: PF2e Animations v{version} loaded. Please check if you don't have new animations to be added to your autorecognition menu!
notifications.noDummy: Missing dummy actors for summoning macros.
notifications.tooManyArgs: Too many arguments for this macro! The following arguments are incompatible: {issues}
notifications.noPrem: You are missing the premium version of JB2A assets to use this animation!
notifications.metaData: This animation WILL be replaced when updated. If you don't want it to be, best way is to temporarily change it's animation or variant to something else, or enabling Debug mode in the settings and pressing the Metadata button again.

suddenCharge.notif: Sudden Charge! Select where you want to move. Right click to cancel.

disguise.name: Name
disguise.tokenImageHint: Make sure it works on the scene, CORS is a fickle god.
disguise.tokenScaleHint: In case the token you are going into is a pop-out token. Or is smaller than you!
disguise.invisibleHint: Enabled by default, this hides the token under the disguise. Useful for disguising into a smaller or a top-down token.

player.unique: The filters are uniquely set as per {unique}.
player.summonArg: Filtered by level (max. level {multiplier} from {spellLevel} level spell).
player.levelArg: Filtered by level {level1} and above, up to {level2}.
player.hasImageArg: Filtered by whether a creature has an image.
player.label: Sorted withâ€¦?
player.nothingFound: Nothing found. Refine your filter arguments!
player.title: Summon Anything

gm.title: Player Summon Request
gm.content:
{user} has requested to summon {amount} {actorName}.

A template has been created showing the location of the summon. If you accept, the summon will be placed on the template. You can move the template before accepting.

Declining the request or Closing this window will delete the template and nothing will be spawned.

onlyImageSummons.name: Only Allow Summons that have an Image
onlyImageSummons.hint: Only allow for summoning of creatures that have an image.

allowUncommonSummons.name: Allow Non-Common Summons
allowUncommonSummons.hint: Allow for summoning of Uncommon, Rare, or Unique creatures by the players. You can also allow this for individual spells by adding "uncommon" to the spells arguments in either Autorecognition Menu or the spell itself on a character sheet.

disableHitAnims.name: Disable "On Hit or Miss" Animations
disableHitAnims.hint: While you can remove these animations from AA's Autorecognition Menu, it will likely come back when you update it. Enable this to disable these animations.

randomHitAnims.name: Make "On Hit or Miss" miss animations appear Off-Target
randomHitAnims.hint: Make miss and critical miss animations appear at a random spot near the missed target token.

autoAccept.name: Automatically accept Effects
autoAccept.hint: Automatically accept Effects from macros, such as adding the Rage Effect when you use the Rage action.

autoUpdate.name: Open Update Menu on Module Update
autoUpdate.hint: Automatically open the Autorecognition Update Menu when the module is updated.

smallTokenScale.name: Default Scale for Small Tokens
smallTokenScale.hint: Determines what scale the animations assume Small characters are. If you use the "Scale tokens according to size" Pathfinder 2e system setting, this setting is disabled and assumed to be 0.8.

debug.name: Debug Mode
debug.hint: Enables console logs of what PF2e Animations module is doing.

tmfx.name: Use Token Magic Effects
tmfx.hint: A few animations benefit from being animated by Token Magic FX rather than Sequencer. Note that this setting is only shown when the Token Magic FX module is installed.
